What is a Reflection Amplification DDoS Attack?

A reflection amplification DDoS attack spoofs the source IP of an attacker’s DNS request, causing amplified response to be sent to the target computer instead of back to the computer that issued the request.

What is a DDoS Extortion Attack?

A DDoS extortion attack, also known as a ransom DDoS attack (RDDoS), occurs when cybercriminals threaten individuals or organizations with a DDoS incursion unless an extortion demand is paid.

What is a DNS reflection/amplification DDoS attack?

DNS reflection/amplification DDoS attacks elicit very large responses from DNS servers, resulting in a denial of services and data inaccessibility.
